meanings.definition: To remove or reduce the legal penalties for a particular action or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Countries may decriminalize certain drugs to help people get treatment instead of punishment.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to decriminalize the possession of small amounts of marijuana.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a relief if they decriminalize parking violations in busy areas.
meanings.sent4: Decriminalizing jaywalking could lead to safer streets and more responsible pedestrians.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a world where they decriminalize all minor offenses and focus on rehabilitation instead.

meanings.definition: To make something no longer a criminal offense.
meanings.sent1: The new law aims to decriminalize homelessness and provide support to those in need.
meanings.sent2: Advocates are pushing to decriminalize sex work to ensure the safety and rights of workers.
meanings.sent3: It would be interesting to decriminalize skipping school, but education is still important.
meanings.sent4: Decriminalizing loitering could help build trust between communities and law enforcement.
meanings.sent5: The proposal to decriminalize public intoxication sparked a debate on public safety measures.
